p: Sixty‐one dogs were recruited during the study period. Twenty‐three and 20 grade ≥ 4 diarrhoea events were recorded among the “diosmectite” and “standard “groups, respectively. Median duration of diarrhoea was significantly shorter (12h versus 96h) in the “diosmectite” group compared to the “standard” group ( P < 0.001). Median QOL score was significantly higher (9/10 versus 7.5/10) in the “diosmectite” group compared to the “standard” group ( P = 0.0032).
